channel.title: Mosses, Liverworts, Lichens (and allies) of Mount Macedon
channel.description: Bryophytes of Mt Macedon and surrounding areas. Includes Mosses, Liverworts and their allies. Lichens are also added to this collection although they are not bryophytes. Identification usually requires detailed examination under the microscope and there will necessarily be some degree of uncertainty in the names given to species level.

item.title: Baeomyces heteromorphus
item.dc:creator: david_francis
item.description: Covering soil on the steep bank of track. Pink fruiting bodies (ascocarps) growing from the green lichen thallus.

item.title: Heteroscyphus fissistipus
item.dc:creator: david_francis
item.description: Leaves narrowing towards apex with about four apical teeth. Lower leaf margin rolled or curved under and attached to the underside of the stem. Underleaves are deeply incised with long teeth. May be included in Chiloscyphus?

item.title: Lembophyllum divulsum
item.dc:creator: david_francis
item.description: Moss growing on fallen tree trunk in fern gully. Leaves spirally arranged on stem, oval and deeply concave. Costa not apparent.

item.title: Hymenophyton flabellatum
item.dc:creator: david_francis
item.description: Covering the side of a fallen log across the creek in a heavily shaded fern gully.

item.title: Symphyogyna podophylla
item.dc:creator: david_francis
item.description: First photo is the female plant showing what I think are two scale-covered archegonia per plant. The second photo I think is the male plant showing rows of antheridial scales along the midrib.

item.title: Atrichum androgynum
item.dc:creator: david_francis
item.description: Moss growing on horizontal surface on the side of the creek.
